posts.author: Aquarius 233
posts.content:
Hi Stag! :)
I don't know all about PGCC, but only the most elementary matters.

First of all, you have to go into this page and choose if you want to run the version with CEP or the one without the CEP; I love the non-CEP version (the v44 beta), as the other one overrides my beloved custom heads....
No haks have to be downloaded, just put the mod. file in modules folder and you are ok! Ready to level your PC to run MTS ;)

Just remember that the first person from your left provides you exp and appropriate level of gold, and then you are free to shop; on the other hand, the area is on the right side (it is a while I don't use it, because now I always begin at lv 1, hope that the directions are right :) ).
The equipment is low-to-mid magic, on the opposite the "Halls of advanced training" provides high-magic equipment.

Hope that I have shed some light on the matter! ;)

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Stag, next to the witch is a blue circle thing, enter it and then it can transport you directly to one of the chapters in the OC.

Next to the witch is also a brown box with a lever. Put something you want inside and then pull the lever once. Now you can have the item(s) you put inside permanently stored and ready to be taken by another character and so on. The box is a persistent storage device.

Look to the mirror to see if you are pretty & also if you have excessive wealth for your level by dnd standards. On the opposite corner is bobo. Hit him with a stick and he will write down your average damage & then store it permanently to the board that is nearby so that you can see which character (don't take it too seriously) hits the hardest.

Best thing about this module is that everything that I described and much, much more are literally ten feet away from each other so you don't have to run circles searching for something.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: The Halls of Advanced Training is also good, to be precise it was amongst the best before everyone started using PGC3. It has a more "verbose" appearance that might be to your liking or not. Both trainers can be installed very easy, just copy the .mod file into your .mod folder and you are done.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Valerfor to the rescue! I'm kidding but I indeed have an easy solution in my mind. First, though, I would have you know that the forge that is besides that dwarf can do pretty much a n y t h i n g you can dream off. It can put any properties, change the name or even the colour of the name of items and be very accurate about the prices it asks. Still, the usage of it would require a mini-tutorial so here comes solution No 2.

Save the character you have created with PGC3  and then import the (same) character to The Halls of Advance Training (link below) then take enough gold from the Hobbits and buy from the merchants around you the items you would have if played normally through the entire OC. The merchants have two categories of items, the normal (what you want) and some custom powerful gear that is level appropriate (for PvP matches). Those merchants have everything that exists, even cursed or plot items so you will have no trouble at all to select your equipment. Drop any axcess gold that you might have and save your character a final time. And next time, just use the "Halls" for the whole procedure ;)

https://neverwintervault.org/project/nw ... ou-edition
